doc.repnme: Transcript of oral history interview with J. Burke Knapp held on September 5, 1986
doc.abstracts: On September 5, 1986, J. Burke Knapp was interviewed on behalf of the World Bank Group Archives oral history program by Robert Oliver. During his tenure at the Bank from 1949 to 1978, Mr, Knapp worked in the following areas: in the department of operations as director for the western hemisphere (1952-1956); in operations as vice president (1956-1972) and as senior vice president (1972-1978); and as chairman of the loan committee (1956-1978). Mr. Knapp collaborated with his colleagues Leonard Rist and Paul Rosenstein-Rodan, to contribute theoretical and statistical analysis of creditworthiness and the economic merits of World Bank projects. His transcript concerns projects in Ghana, India, and also country review policies of Hollis Chenery and Anne Krueger.
